newsitem.title: USA: Gucci ADRs drop after EPS warning.
newsitem.headline: Gucci ADRs drop after EPS warning.

text.p: Gucci Group NV's ADRs fell on Thursday after an earnings forecast by the luxury goods maker that fell short of analysts' estimates, traders and an analyst said.

The company's American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) were off 4-7/8 at 69-1/2 in early afternoon. Volume was three times greater than normal, pushing Gucci on to the New York Stock Exchange's most-active list.
The company reported Thursday that fiscal first-quarter sales rose 31.5 percent to $254.3 million, beyond Gucci's expectations.
However, in a conference call with analysts, company executives forecast earnings of $3.35 per share for its current fiscal year, said Elizabeth Vilizzi, an ABN AMRO analyst in London.
A consensus estimate by analysts had called for earnings of $3.90 per share. In the fiscal year ended January 31, the company earned $2.76 per share.
"I guess that this is the major reason for the decrease in the stock price," Vilizzi told Reuters.
Gucci had "said since the beginning that they were comfortable with this estimate, but analysts had expected higher growth."
A trader said the drop also might reflect profit-taking. The stock rose 2-3/8 Wednesday in expectation of the results and had come off a recent low of 63-3/4 on May 8.
